Package index

flexseq

Persistent sequences with fast append/prepend for double-ended queue behavior. Quick and memory-efficient concatenation and splitting by name or index. Other structures below (e.g. priority queues)

flexseq()
Construct a Persistent Flexible Sequence
as_flexseq()
Coerce to a Persistent Flexible Sequence
prepend()
Prepend an element
append(<flexseq>)
Append an element to a flexseq
split_at()
Split by Scalar Index or Name
c(<flexseq>)
Concatenate Sequences
print(<flexseq>)
Print a flexseq
length(<flexseq>)
Sequence Length
as.list(<flexseq>)
Coerce a Sequence to Base List
apply()
Apply with S3 dispatch
plot(<flexseq>)
Plot a Sequence Tree

flexseq indexing

Indexing functions for list-like behavior. Note that these operations are generally O(klog⁡(n))O(k\log(n)) where kk is the size of the index vector and nn the size of the sequence.

`[`(<flexseq>)
Subset a flexseq by position or element name
`[[`(<flexseq>)
Extract one element by position or unique name
`[<-`(<flexseq>)
Replace selected elements by position or name
`[[<-`(<flexseq>)
Replace one element by position or unique name
`$`(<flexseq>)
Extract a named element with `$`
`$<-`(<flexseq>)
Replace a named element with `$<-`

priority_queue

Persistent priority queues associate priority values with items and provide O(log⁡(n))O(\log(n)) insertion and min/max operations. Priority queues intentionally expose queue-oriented APIs only; sequence-style edits/traversal should cast first with as_flexseq().

priority_queue()
Construct a Priority Queue
as_priority_queue()
Build a Priority Queue from elements and priorities
insert()
Insert an element
is_empty()
Check emptiness with S3 dispatch
peek_min()
Peek minimum-priority element
peek_max()
Peek maximum-priority element
extract_min()
Extract minimum-priority element
extract_max()
Extract maximum-priority element
print(<priority_queue>)
Print a Priority Queue

ordered_sequence

Persistent key-ordered sequences.

ordered_sequence()
Construct an Ordered Sequence
as_ordered_sequence()
Build an Ordered Sequence from elements
insert()
Insert an element
merge(<ordered_sequence>)
Merge ordered keyed sequences
peek_key()
Peek first element for one key
extract_key()
Extract first element for one key
delete_one()
Delete one element by key
delete_all()
Delete all elements by key
lower_bound()
Find first element with key >= value
upper_bound()
Find first element with key > value
elements_between()
Return elements in a key range
print(<ordered_sequence>)
Print an ordered sequence summary

ordered_multiset

Bag semantics layered on ordered_sequence.

ordered_multiset()
Construct an Ordered Multiset
as_ordered_multiset()
Build an Ordered Multiset from elements
union() intersect() setdiff()
Set operations with S3 dispatch
print(<ordered_multiset>)
Print an ordered multiset summary

developer

Lower-level constructors, query primitives, and tooling

add_monoids()
Add/merge monoids on an existing tree
locate_by_predicate()
Locate First Predicate Flip Without Reconstructing Context Trees
split_around_by_predicate()
Split Around First Predicate Flip
split_by_predicate()
Split a flexseq into Left and Right Parts by Predicate
measure_monoid()
Construct a Measure Monoid Specification
predicate()
Construct a Predicate Function
validate_tree()
Validate full tree invariants (debug/test utility)
validate_name_state()
Validate name-state invariants only (debug/test utility)
